description: Machine demonstrating Deutsch's problem and how a quantum Turing machine can solve it with only a single call to the oracle. In this example, f(x) in Deutsch's problem is balanced.
rules: M1: Set bit 0 (x) on the tape into superposition
M1: Set bit 1 (y) on the tape into superposition
M0: Read bit 0 (x) and move on to cell 1, storing the bit in the state
M0: x = 0, read bit 1 (y) and write y XOR x back
M0: x = 1, read bit 1 (y) and write y XOR x back
M0: collapse the superposition on bit 0 (x)
